definition: to create/to come up with (an idea etc)
to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create

sentences.english: Life creates itself in delirium and is undone in ennui.
sentences.chinese: 生命自创于狂乱，破灭于厌倦中。

sentences.english: He creates a Five- Five teaching mode which is appreciated by the education circle.
sentences.chinese: 自创五五制教学模式深得教育界肯定。

sentences.english: And the new subjects created originally by Tang People consist of two types.
sentences.chinese: 唐人完全自创的乐府诗新题目，其方式主要有两种。

sentences.english: The internally generated intangible assets are the core of competitive power in the times of knowledge economy.
sentences.chinese: 知识经济下，自创无形资产是企业的核心竞争力所在。

sentences.english: I wrote this book to inspire people who want to create their own beaded jewelry.
sentences.chinese: 我写这本书是为了激发那些自创珍珠首饰的人的灵感。

sentences.english: Members can then create a physical cookbook. This is great for gifts.
sentences.chinese: 会员可据此自创一本食谱书，用它馈赠亲友。

sentences.english: From a long point of view, only self-created brand will boost China's economy.
sentences.chinese: 自创品牌才是振兴中国经济的长远之道。

sentences.english: Whatever it is out-purchased or self-created, the value of goodwill always comes from the inner of enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 无论是外购还是自创，商誉的价值都产生于企业内部。

sentences.english: Mr. He Zhiqiang is a Best CEO of self-create brand who wins many social honors in practice.
sentences.chinese: 实践中赢得诸多社会荣誉和自创品牌的最佳CEO。

sentences.english: Zeng Yun Winning the Champion of Men's Group C Freestyle Boxing.
sentences.chinese: 曾云以自创的“行云拳”夺得男子C组其他拳术冠军。

sentences.english: The amortization of self-produced goodwill should be reevaluated year after year.
sentences.chinese: 对自创商誉的摊销可采用逐年重估法。

sentences.english: She writes, sings her own songs and also plays piano fantastically.
sentences.chinese: 她自创自唱她的歌，并弹奏一手非常棒的钢琴。

sentences.english: Teacher-created web-based materials may also be ripe for marketing.
sentences.chinese: 老师自创的基于网络的素材对市场来说也许是成熟的。

sentences.english: This is a new dance, created by the fine arts Department.
sentences.chinese: 这个新舞蹈是由泰国文艺部自创的。

sentences.english: Oho, the feeling is no bad to design a new words.
sentences.chinese: 哇，自创了个新词感觉真不错。

definition: to hand down secret knowledge from generation to generation within a school or family etc
unique skill/unexpected tricky move (as a last resort)/masterstroke/finishing blow
handed down in a family/family traditions
to reach perfection (idiom); a superb artistic achievement
to learn/to acquire (some skill through practice)/acquisition
